title: Strengthening Curriculum Development Practical Competencies: Mobile-Based Intensive Language Course for Immigrant Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: After a one-week intensive course, learners achieve at least 2 points on a 3-point rubric for intermediate-level (CEFR B1) language proficiency in job-related oral presentations (3 minutes) and business document writing (emails/reports), evaluated on syntactic diversity, appropriateness of workplace terminology, and clarity of communication

Within one week, learners use mobile learning tools (Quizlet, Duolingo, etc.) and real-time video conferencing (Zoom, Google Meet, etc.) to create a self-directed language learning plan of at least three sessions per week, reporting outcomes via a learning journal and a 10-minute video presentation

Within one week, learners demonstrate language application skills (communication, material development, feedback provision) through project-based assessment (real-world educational scenario tasks), producing a report and presentation materials that achieve "excellent" or higher in at least four of five field expert evaluation rubric items
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
